fields.description:
I'm using greenhopper and have set the issue type schemes to "GreenHopper Scrum Issue Type Scheme" on 2 projects. 
I'm trying to move an issue of type "story" between these 2 projects with the "move this issue" operation on the issue page. It fails at first step (clicking next after selecting the new project, and letting the issue type as is) with this error message : "The issue type selected is invalid." No error or exception in the logs.

Strange things are :
- issue types are correctly recognized (trying to move to a non scrum project forces to change the issue type)
- moving to a default issue type succeeds (bug or improvement, but not epic which is also a greenhopper issue type)... but of course I loose all the extra fields (business value, story points...)
- bulk moving the issue (from tools/bulk change on the issues list page) succeeds and keeps all data (issue type, extra fields...)

So I have a workaround by "bulk" moving the issue I want to move, but it is an inconsistent behavior that you might want to fix. 
Sorry if it has already been reported but I couldn't find it in your Jira.
fields.summary: Move issue fails where bulk move issue succeeds

fields.description:
After installing Jira Labels plugin, I identified some errors when viewing labels in the Labels Heatmap (select a project then click in the Labels tab):

* If you select *View -> Popular Labels* or *View -> All Labels*, the system automatically selects *View -> Popular Labels* and *Fields -> the first custom field* (they are ordered alphabetically), so you can't view All Labels for other than the first custom field listed in View.

* When selecting *View -> Popular Labels* and *Fields -> any custom field* you only can order labels by popularity for the first custom field listed in View; for other custom fields, clicking in *Order -> Popularity* will automatically select *View -> Popular Labels* and *Fields -> the first custom field*.

These problems prevent the user from viewing labels correctly.
fields.summary: Errors when viewing labels in the Labels Heatmap - after installing Jira Labels plugin

fields.description:
Some time in the last week or two, all of the issues that I was watching on http://jira.atlassian.com/ became unwatched by me.  This represents several years of work and is a huge data loss.  If I now do a JQL query of "issue in watchedIssues()", the only resolved issue that appears is JRA-19248, which means that the data loss probably occurred some time shortly before March 25th when that issue was marked resolved.

Please restore this lost data so I can see which issues I was tracking and be informed when there are updates to old tickets.
fields.summary: All of my watched issues on http://jira.atlassian.com/ that were resolved were unwatched

fields.description:
Please add support for Google Chrome for Jira. Right now almost everything works fine (most of the times even better) in Chrome, but one of the things that doesn't work is the datepicker. When I click the datepicker in Chrome nothing happens, but when I use Firefox or IE8 it does work. I think support for Chrome should be available now Chrome is used by more and more people.

I filed a Support request about this issue, and I was recommended to file a Feature request for this, because Chrome is not on the supported browsers list.
fields.summary: Add support for Google Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20754].
  {panel}

The jira-application.properties file is a potential source of problems. 
* Some of the properties are difficult to configure correctly (for instance jira.date.time.picker.java.format/jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format). 
* It is also difficult to determine which of those properties you have changed in your installation, so you can apply the changes when you upgrade. 
* We also see customers that forget to update these properties during an upgrade, which can be quite problematic (a typical example is forgetting to update the jira.projectkey.pattern property, which results into users not being able to see issues that do not much the current pattern)

I think most of those properties should be stored in the database, with Jira providing a user interface to modify them. That means that we could do proper validation of the entries, and the values would persist during upgrades.
fields.summary: Move jira-application.properties to database and user interface

(I know this isn't exactly the right project for this, but I didn't see an obvious place for "Atlassian's public website" issues.)

I just pasted part of the Starter License FAQ in an email, and Outlook noticed a typo: "mainteance" should be "maintenance".

http://www.atlassian.com/starter/faq.jsp#hidden

Is this a hidden introductory offer price?
No, our Starter Licenses are just $10 each. This includes 12 months of software ***mainteance*** (support and updates). Furthermore, the amount you will pay in subsequent years for additional years of Starter License software maintenance is just $10.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20748].
  {panel}

I would like to know if there any third party tool available to integrate Remedy with JIRA. We want to use JIRA as one source of issue management tool within our development group. So I would like JIRA to integrate with the following tools:

(1) Quality Center (HP)
(2) BMC Remedy
(3) CA Clarity

I know there are tools to integrate with Quality Center. I am not sure about the other two.

Are there tools to do that. Basically if one group creates an issue in Quality Center, it should automatically be routed to the developer in JIRA. All the tools share the NT authentication.

I would also like to know what are the best ways to integrate with Share point servers.

Any help in this regard will be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: third party tools integration

fields.description:
When display of email addresses is disabled in JIRA, the 'Contact Administrators' page only displays a list of names, with no information on how to actually contact someone.

Ideally, I'd like a way to define a custom email address or website that would be displayed on that page; or, if that's not possible, at least have a way to display administrators' addresses even when email display is disabled.

fields.description:
After updating from Jira 3.13.2 to 4.0.2, when you browse into a project and click "Filters" -> "Assigned to me", the search returns no issues even if there are issues assigned to the user.  

Jira executes the query with this JQL:
project = XYZ AND assignee = currentUser() AND resolution = Unresolved

Issues only are returned if you remove "AND resolution = Unresolved", but then it does not fetch the issues you may be interested in.

The problem is resolved if you install Jira Charting Plugin (to add the resolution custom field) and perform a system indexing. No problems would be caused if the custom field was directly installed with Jira 4.0.2.
fields.summary: Issue resolution lost with upgrade from 3.13.2 to 4.0.2

fields.description:
I got this suggestion from one of our users Becky:
{quote}
Here's the deal: Sub-tasks are a royal pain in the posterior for a Jira originator. A sub-task generates an entirely new Jira number. So, for example, I am being queried about Jira XXX-48197 - which means nothing to me, and it's not on any of my personal lists of "what I'm doing with Jira." I have to go look it up, and it turns out it's a sub-task of XXX-47931. Now, 47931 means something to me. But its sub-task numbers and titles certainly do not.

This gets very cumbersome and confusing with multiple sub-tasks on multiple tickets.

Couldn't the Jira system assign sub-tasks sequential identifiers of some sort, like XXX-47931c....which would tell me this was the 3rd sub-task associated w/Jjira 47931? Or XXX-47931-2, which would mean the 2nd sub-task associated w/ Jira 47931? Or really anything so the originator can look at the deluge of emails and say, "Ummmm...okay. All 22 of these emails apply to my one ticket. What's going on w/it?"
{quote}

Our users also noticed that subtask e-mails do not contain parent task number it their subjects and bodies. Including the parent task number in sub-task e-mails will make it easy for user to seach for all parent task's sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Suggestion for Enhancement to Jira: Sequential Sub-Task Identifiers

fields.description:
It would be helpful to allow a different Project Manager and a set of different Components(and their associated component leads) to be set based on Project Phases.  The last few companies where I have used Jira, usually start Inception/Elaboration of the next phase of a project while we are still doing construction/transition of the first phase.  Also, I find it common to have a different project manager assigned as well as additional components being added.  

Currently, we have to set these up as different Projects in Jira.  This works ok, but does not allow us to use the Road Map feature when we do.  Thanks !
fields.summary: Set project manager and components for each phase

fields.description:
We have JIRA Unlimited Users, but in User Browser JIRA is writing the message on license limit -
bq. There are currently NNN total user(s) set up in JIRA, of which MMM are active and {color:red}count towards your license limit{color}. 

This message is very misleading as it seems that JIRA is putting a user limit. For an instance with unlimited user, this message is not needed.
fields.summary: Confusing message on license limit

fields.description:
As an IT Manager, by having to add users to the Administrators group in order to edit and manage workflows is prohibitive to the administration and security of our Jira environment.  While I want users to create, manage and edit workflows, I do NOT want them creating or modifying accounts (which comes with the Admin priviledges).

Editing/Managing/Creating workflows should be a project scheme, or have the permissions seperated out from the Administrators group.  I.e. have a global "Workflows Administrators" group, or something like that.

Thanks,
-Adrian
fields.summary: Allow non-Administrators to be able to modify workflows
Add ability to compare version fields using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20727].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your interest in this issue. This suggestion is considered a potential addition to our longer-term roadmap. We'll typically review this request in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

For the nearest future we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including the top-voted suggestions:
 * Further performance and stability improvements
 * Email notifications template editor available from the UI JRASERVER-7266
 * Jira email notifications batching JRASERVER-1369
 * Mobile app for Jira Server JRASERVER-46149
 * Improved filter and dashboard management by Jira administrators JRASERVER-15900 and JRASERVER-41269 
 * Adding the "updated-by" JQL search query JRASERVER-1973
 * Support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection JRASERVER-36135

In the recent Jira Server releases we have also shipped some highly-voted features and improvements, including:
 * Filters and dashboards collaborative editing
 * Selectable delimiters in CSV export 
 * Microsoft SQL Server 2016 support 
 * iPv6 support
 * Faster Kanban boards
 * Refreshed projects and custom fields management pages in the admin's section 

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our [approach to highly voted server suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

To learn more on how you suggestions are reviewed, see our [updated workflow for server feature suggestions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/An-updated-workflow-for-Server-feature-suggestions/ba-p/721632#M113].

Kind regards,
 Jira Server Product Management
{panel}
In JQL, it's currently only possible to compare dates either with a single fixed date, or with a function such as now(), currentLogin(), or lastLogin(). It would be useful to be able to compare two date fields to one another, as in this seemingly simple query:
{code:java}
resolutiondate > duedate
{code}
This would allow filtering for issues that were resolved after their due date.
fields.summary: Add ability to compare date fields using JQL

fields.description:
It would be nice to have another drop-down list in the "Create Issue" page.
There are currently two drop-down lists, "Project" and "Issue type".
They work great, however, for organizations that have hundrends of projects, another drop down list (called "Project Category") would be very usefull. This could be placed at position #1 and whenever its value changes, the "Project" list is aumatically updated to show only relevant projects (the ones that belong to the selected category).

Optionally, can you provide a replacement for the jsp page (?createissue-start.jsp?)?
fields.summary: Allow to select "Project Category" when creating a new issue

fields.description:
JIRA lib includes xfire-aegis-1.2.6.jar & xfire-core-1.2.6.jar, but both of those jar files don't include transport.http.ProxyUtils, so JAVA_OPT "-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts" isn't supported by JIRA. 

May need add xfire-java5-1.2.6.jar into lib, or replace by xfire-all-1.2.6.jar. Bamboo has included xfire-java5-1.2.6.jar and Confluence has used xfire-all-1.2.6.jar.
fields.summary: JAVA option "-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts" doesn't work for JIRA

fields.description:
Tested on *JIRA 4.1 rc-1* on an issue with enough comments for scrolling.

Steps to replicate in Firefox 3.6:
- Either click on a comments permalink, right-click and 'open in a new tab' or copy/paste its URL in a new tab. The browser redirects to comment header which is properly visible under the stalker bar
- Then hit enter on the permalink URL in the address bar in either of the above cases. The comment header is *behind* the stalker bar
\\ Refreshing the page then displays it correctly

Seems to be due to the anchor ID and stalker bar height not being re-evaluated.

\\
Internet Explorer 8 has mixed results:
- Either click on a comments permalink, right-click and 'open in a new tab' or copy/paste its URL in a new tab. The comment is highlighted but the browser doesn't redirect to it, instead to either the top of or somewhere else on the page
\\ Then do either one of the following:
-- Clicking on the same permalink a second time in either of the above cases redirects to the comment header and displays it correctly
\\ _OR_
-- Hit enter in URL (doesn't fix it), but then refreshing does. The cycle between 'Enter' and 'Refresh' continuously 'messes it-fixes it up'.
\\ Sometimes the opposite is true. Refresh the browser (doesn't fix it), but then hitting enter does. In this case:
--- When Left-clicking a permalink, refreshing *always* works on first go
--- When right-clicking or copy/pasting the URL in the address bar, refreshing *sometimes* works on first go
fields.summary: Stalkerbar overlaps comment header when permalinks are accessed through browser address bar

fields.description:
NOTE: The description for this bug is old. See Brads last 2 comments for the problem and potential solutions.

There is a bug in FireFox 3.6 that causes it to POST zero parameters to the server.

This tends to occur after say a 5 minutes time frame after say starting an issue and pressing submit.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=547239

The bug report mentions that it has been fixed but at the time of this post, a new version of FireFox is not available.

Our recommendation is to roll back to FireFox 3.5 or move up to FireFox 3.6.1 when it becomes available.


MORE NOTES :

Our QA staff have discovered the following

{quote}
This bug affects Windows/Linux(Ubuntu) when user has selected "Auto Detect proxy setting for network". If the option is "no proxy", its working fine without any issues.Tested with WinXp and Win Vista. 

Create Issue operation is working fine on Mac X.6 with FF 3.6 with both proxy set to no/Auto.
{quote}
fields.summary: JIRA Submits no form data after 5 minutes - Actions such as CreateIssue will then failed with a session expiry

fields.description:
Currently, if an issue is moved, the Project Lead for the project the issue resides in is notified, but *not* the Project Lead for the project the issue is moved into. These Leads are usually different people and it is important for the new owner to be notified the issues have been moved into his work area. 

We'd like to see the notification scheme extended to include an option to notify the project lead of the project the issue is moved into.
fields.summary: Extend Notifications Scheme to allow for notification when an issue is moved *into* a project, not just out of a project.

fields.description:
Hi,
I'm installing a Jira instance and I want to move the JIRA_HOME to a NFS drive.
Following this golden rule (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Indexing+in+JIRA) I want to change the default index directory to a local directory (= not on NFS drive).

I can change the default index directory from the reindexing page (http://jira/secure/admin/jira/IndexAdmin.jspa) but if I clean the index directory content and launch a reindex, I see that in the new, custom directory, are created the 'comments' and 'issues' directory, while in the default, JIRA_HOME, directory, is created the 'entities' directory (which contains 'portalpage' and 'searchrequest' directory).

Is this OK? I expected that also the 'entities' directory was to be created in the new custom index directory.
fields.summary: Custom index directory does not contains all indexes

fields.description:
If we insert a user to the custom field Group Picker or Multi Group Picker, the custom field will accept it without throwing any error. 

This can be reproduce by:
# create custom field Group Picker and add it to screen
# insert user by typing the username manually.
# the custom field Group Picker type will accept the value.

If Multi Group Picker is used, multiple users can be added by inserting their name manually. In screenshot attached, G Picker is a Group Picker and MG Picker is Multi Group Picker.

Cheers,
Janet
fields.summary: Inserting user to a Group Picker/Multi Group Picker is possible where it is suppose to accept only Group

Firefox 3.6 (Linux and Windows version) was used both times.

fields.description:
Currently JIRA assigns regular ticket numbers to subtasks making it impossible to see just by the ticket number itself that it is a subtask.

It would help a great deal if this could be changed so that the first subtask for issue JIRA-1100 would receive the ticketnumber JIRA-1100-1, the second JIRA-1100-2 and so on.
fields.summary: Ticket number should reflect subtask status of an issue

fields.description: We are constantly getting an error message when we save a JIRA issue after doing any work on it such as commenting on it or adding watchers.  Report is *Unable to perform action* _{color:red}Errors{color}: The issue no longer exists_. It's getting very annoying with may users reporting it.

fields.description:
The jira Linux script in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Starting+JIRA+Standalone+automatically+on+Linux contains errors.

Below my corrected version:
--------------
#!/bin/sh -e
# JIRA startup script
#chkconfig: 2345 80 05
#description: JIRA
 
# Define some variables
# Name of app ( JIRA, Confluence, etc )
APP=jira
# Name of the user to run as
USER=jira
# Location of application's bin directory
BASE=/opt/jira
export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/default

case "$1" in
# Start command
start)
echo "Starting $APP"
/bin/su -m $USER -c "cd $BASE/logs && $BASE/bin/startup.sh &> $BASE/logs/daemon-start.log"
;;
# Stop command
stop)
echo "Stopping $APP"
/bin/su -m $USER -c "$BASE/bin/shutdown.sh &> $BASE/logs/daemon-stop.log"
echo "$APP stopped successfully"
;;
# Restart command
restart)
$0 stop
sleep 10
$0 start
;;
*)
echo "Usage: /etc/init.d/$APP {start|restart|stop}"
exit 1
;;
esac
 
exit 0
--------------

fields.description:
Write up how to make JIRA meet a stricter set of security policies.

We get security audit reports, usually generated from high end automated tools, which contain assertions of problems in JIRA.

Usually, the vast majority of these reported problems have already been fixed or are determined to be of very low negative impact. 

JIRA ships in a security configuration that is a deliberate balance of convenience and security which doesn't match everyone's needs.

For those organisations that have stricter security requirements than the default configuration, JIRA must be configured and in some cases modified to suit the customer. This needs to be documented as a How-To guide for auditors to use and refer to before contacting support.

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

* Create a custom field and name it <font color="red">Hithere</font>
* On view issue screens, the field appears as <font color="red">Hithere</font>
* On edit issue screen, the field appears as Hithere on red font

I guess we need to make a decision on which one is the desired functionality (allow HTML or not) and make it consistent across screens.
fields.summary: Custom fileds inconsistently escaped in view and edit screens

fields.description:
The Description "twixie" was implemented to disappear for short descriptions.  An unintended side effect of this implementation is that linefeeds are stripped from short descriptions, which can severely impact their legibility.

The "smart twixie" has some edge cases which make it appear inconsistent - if we show the linefeeds but hide the twixie, then we can have a "long" description without a twixie in some places but not others.  If we add a twixie for any description with a linefeed, then we have some short descriptions with twixies and some without.

The latter solution is preferable, because it maintains behaviour with a description that starts with several linefeeds and then continues for >255 characters.  

A very low-risk solution might be to remove the "smart twixie" implementation altogether, and go back to showing a twixie regardless of the length of the description field.
fields.summary: Linefeeds are sometimes stripped from Description field when the description is less than 255 characters.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create three users in JIRA: "admin", "fred", "john"
# Create a custom Multi User Picker field & add it to the default screen
# Create a project if there isn't an existing one
# Create an issue
# In the multi user picker field, type "admin" and select him from the drop-down
# ..., type "fred" and select him from the drop-down
# ..., type "john" and select him from the drop-down

Result: you will notice that there are additional spaces being inserted in between "admin" and "fred". The more users you add, the more spaces get inserted.
fields.summary: Multi User Picker autocomplete creates extra spaces in between values when selecting multiple values

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create two users in JIRA: "admin" and "fred"
# Create a custom Multi User Picker field & add it to the default screen
# Create a project if there isn't an existing one
# Create an issue
# In the multi user picker field, type "admin, admin" and select "admin" from the dropdown. You should see the "Oops" message about entering "admin" twice.
# *VERY QUICKLY* then type "fred" and select him from the dropdown.

Result: the "Oops" error about "admin" will never disappear. Even if you recreate the error for another user (e.g. by typing "fred" again).
fields.summary: Multi User Picker validation popup does not disappear if multiple errors are triggered

fields.description: With the new slick, non tables joy of JIRA, there's much more leeway for people to style up their JIRA pages. It'd awesome to have a per project custom CSS that allows users to _add_ more styles to the page. This wouldn't replace any existing style sheets, but add an additional project specific one so people can style things exactly how they want.
fields.summary: Custom CSS per Project

fields.description: When loading an issue with a lot of information in JIRA 4.1-rc1 (like, say, JRA-3821) the issue cannot be scrolled for up to 8-10 seconds.  In JIRA 4.0, the issue would take only a second or two to load and was able to be scrolled immediately.  This long wait time until you can scroll is a significant usability issue.
fields.summary: The issue view in locks up scrolling until the issue has finished loading

fields.description:
When viewing an issue on JIRA 4.1 and scrolling down past the header bars, the "sticky" bar that tries to stay at the top of the page ends up getting partially redrawn in the correct place while other parts of the "sticky" bar get scrolled up off the top of the screen.  The bar gets redrawn in the correct place and then partially scrolled off again several times a second, resulting in a strobing effect that is quite jarring.

This does not appear to happen for me on my Windows box, only under RedHat Enterprise Linux.
fields.summary: Scrolling on an issue view page causes the page to tear/strobe

fields.description:
The new issue view page in JIRA 4.1 as currently deployed on jira.atlassian.com uses an unprofessionally-large font that results in the user needing to scroll down to view even basic details about the issue.  For instance, a simple issue like JRA-18349, used to fit comfortably on one page in a browser window, but it is now necessary to scroll down just to view all of the link information, and one must scroll down a lot to see the last comment.  On tickets with many links or a long description, the tickets require so much scrolling that they are very hard to read.  Please significantly reduce the font size and eliminate wasted whitespace such as the large blank areas surrounding the dividing lines between sections.

I have tested this on Firefox 3.0 under Linux and using IE 8 and Firefox 3.5 on Windows XP and all have the same issue.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.1 issue view wastes screen space

fields.description: Currently entities in JIRA can get only one level of sub-tasks. This is painfully limiting. To be able to track/group all activities for a major feature, JIRA needs to give users the ability to break a task more than one-level deep.
fields.summary: child tasks

fields.description:
Overview:
-when a developer leaves the company we would like to disable their Jira account.

Issue:
-the only way to disable an account is to delete it; the problem with deleting is that I then lose all tracebility on the tickets that user worked on

Proposed Solution:
-create a 'disable' feature for Jira users
--disabled users will not appear on the 'Assign To' lists
--disabled users should not count against the license
fields.summary: User Management > The ability to set a user as 'disabled' vs. having to delete
